law.catch_line: If the Commissioner denies an application, the Commissioner:...

text.section:
If the Commissioner denies an application, the Commissioner:
Within 10 days, shall notify the applicant, in writing, of the denial; and
Shall keep the license fee and the investigation fee.

Within 30 days after the Commissioner denies an application, the Commissioner shall:
Issue a written decision containing the specific factual findings and conclusions of law on which the denial was based;
Send a copy of the written decision by certified mail to the applicant; and
Advise the applicant by certified mail of the applicant's right to a hearing to be held in accordance with the Administrative Procedure Act.

An applicant who seeks a hearing on an application denial shall file with the Commissioner's office a written request for a hearing within 45 days after receipt of the Commissioner's written decision and notice of the applicant's right to a hearing.
